ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 46. Upper respiratory infection
Allergies affect child breathing through nose
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = Do not know; 9 = Missing value; -1 = Not applicable

ElementDescription: Current Nasal Problem: Current nasal congestion from other known source (ie., deviated septum, past severe respiratory infection resulting in probable smell/taste problem)
Current Nasal Problem: Sum of above 3 questions
Medications - Current: On antihistamine or other cold/allergy med (pills only)
Medications - Current: Use of nose spray - currently
Taken other medications
Medications - Current: Sum of above 3 questions
History of head injury with loss of consciousness
Medical History - Associated with Head/Neck/Nose Lifetime: Facial trauma to nose (broken etc. - could be in same accident as led to L.O.C.)
Medical History - Associated with Head/Neck/Nose Lifetime: Previous head/neck/nose surgery (rhinoplasty)
Medical History - Associated with Head/Neck/Nose Lifetime: Sum of above 3 questions
Specify any other medical condition
Other Medical/Physiological Conditions: Number of medical conditions subject is currently treated for
Other Medical/Physiological Conditions: Do you suffer from smell or taste problems?
Other Medical/Physiological Conditions: Have you ever used cocaine or other drugs intranasally?
If female, are you currently menstruating?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; 3= N/A= Male; -900 = Missing; -300 = N/A

ElementDescription: Other Medical/Physiological Conditions: Sum of above 4 questions
Do you currently smoke any cigarettes? Y/N
If smoking, estimate number of cigarettes per day
indicate the number of years that the participant has smoked cigarettes
Smoking History: How many cigars per day currently?
About how many cigarettes smoke per day
How old were you when you first started smoking cigarettes FAIRLY REGULARLY? PX030702_First_Cigarette_Smoking_Regularly_Age
Have you ever smoked a cigarette, even a puff?
Former smoker. At what age did you smoke your first cigarette?
Former smoker. When did you smoke your last cigarette?
Protocol C is used with adults who are Former Smokers.  When you last smoked every day, on average how many cigarettes did you smoke each day? PX030802_Former_Smoker_Quantity_1DayB
Smoking History: f subject is not a current smoker:  How many cigars/day?
Smoking History: If subject is not a current smoker: Did your smell ability change after stopping?
Smoking History: If subject is not a current smoker: How did your smell ability change after stopping?  (describe)
Olfactory hallucinations experienced when not intoxicated?
